posts.caption: This mornings dilemma... avocado or peanut butter?! Or both? 🤗😂✨ Sliced avo with fresh black pepper, chili, salt & olive oil 🥑 -- PB with chili, sea salt & olive oil (trust me, SO yum!!) 🥜 Which would you choose?! ✌🏻 x  #gatherandfeast

crispy mushroom carbonara 😍✨ RECIPE below👇🏻 this is my vegetarian take on the classic carbonara and it is delicious!! the mushrooms with the garlic and smokey paprika are👌🏻 enjoy! x
•
INGREDIENTS
•
4 large brown flat mushrooms, cubed
20g butter
Sea salt
1 tsp thyme leaves
1/2 tsp smokey paprika
3 cloves garlic, finely chopped or crushed
380g @barillaaus spaghetti, cooked al-dente
4 egg yolks
100g parmigiano-reggiano
•
METHOD
•
sauté mushrooms with the butter, smokey paprika & thyme leaves on high until cooked & very golden & crispy.
add the garlic & sauté for another minute.
add the cooked spaghetti to the mushroom mixture with another 10g butter, 100g grated parmesan & 1/2 cup of reserved pasta water.
serve the spaghetti hot with a fresh egg yolk on top* & a heap of freshly cracked black pepper. *or add the egg yolks with the butter, parmigiano, & water, & stir through the spaghetti before serving. enjoy! Ash x #gatherandfeast

🍌 QUICK TIP when freezing bananas for smoothies👆🏻
•
When freezing over-ripe bananas for smoothies, cakes, pancakes or banana bread I like to peel and slice the bananas onto a paper-lined tray and freeze them overnight
•
Then either use them straight from the tray or transfer to a zip-lock bag or container to store back in the freezer
•
I find freezing the bananas on a tray first before transferring prevents them from sticking together in one big clump
•
Also, to measure ‘1 banana’ I usually cut each banana into 8 slices/chunks then when I need ‘1 banana’ for a recipe I know how many pieces to use 👍🏻
•
I know this is the simplest of tips 😂 but I thought I’d share as we find it super useful ☺️❤️ Please, feel free to share any quick & easy kitchen tips you might have in the comments below! Ash✌🏻 x #gatherandfeast

✨😍 Buckwheat Crepes with Yoghurt, Grapes, Maple & Bee Pollen - RECIPE below 👇🏻🥞 We enjoyed these for breakfast a few weeks ago - topped with sweet sultana grapes, pure maple + a sprinkling of bee pollen. Yum! I also added some raspberries after I took this photo👌🏻 I have used natural sheeps milk yoghurt but for dairy free use coconut yoghurt. Here's the recipe... x
•
INGREDIENTS
•
1 1/4 cups flour (I’ve used 1 cup of buckwheat flour + 1/4 cup spelt flour)
2 cups almond milk
1 egg
1/4 tsp vanilla
A pinch of sea salt
•
METHOD
•
Whisk the ingredients together in a mixing bowl until super smooth, allow the mixture to rest for 10-15 minutes.
Add a tiny bit of coconut oil or butter to a non stick pan on medium to high heat.
Roughly add 3/4 cup of the crepe batter and swirl around your pan so it thinly coats the pan. If it feels a little thick whisk a little more milk into the mixture. Also, I find the first crepe or pancake is always a dud (why is that?!) so don’t worry, the rest will be great!
Once little bubbles begin to surface on the crepe flip it over and cook for roughly 30 seconds.
Remove from pan onto a plate and set aside.
Cook the rest of the mixture and serve warm with yoghurt, pure maple and your favourite fruit.
•
Enjoy! Ash✌🏻 x  #gatherandfeast

✨ NEW RECIPE -- Coconut, Raspberry & Strawberry Layer Cake 🍓🥥😍 this beauty is SO delicious PLUS it’s dairy, refined sugar and grain free 🤗🙌🏻 here’s the recipe... hope you enjoy!! x
•
INGREDIENTS
•
Coconut Sponge Cake
•
6 large eggs, separated
1 ¼ cup pure maple syrup
1 tsp vanilla (extract, powder or paste)
150g solid coconut oil, melted and set aside to cool slightly
1 ½ cups blanched almond meal
1 ½ cups dessicated coconut
¾ cup buckwheat flour
1 tsp bicarb soda
2 tsp baking powder
2 tsp apple cider vinegar
1 ½ cups coconut milk
½ tsp flaked sea salt
•
Filling
•
500g thick coconut yoghurt (I like to use @coyo_is_coconuts)
1 cup good quality raspberry jam
Fresh strawberries & raspberries for topping
•
METHOD
•
Coconut Sponge Cake
•
Pre-heat your oven to 180C / 350F.
Grease and line 3 x 20cm round cake tins.
Whisk together the egg yolks and maple until light and fluffy.
Add the vanilla and melted coconut oil, whisk to combine.
Fold in the almond meal, coconut, buckwheat flour, bicarb, baking soda and apple cider vinegar, until just combined.
Add the coconut milk and sea salt and fold together to combine.
Whisk egg whites until stiff and fold through the mixture.
Pour the mixture evenly into the three pre-prepared tins.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and set aside to cool completely.
Remove the cakes from the tins and set aside to cool.
•
To Assemble
•
Spread the first cake layer with raspberry jam and a few dollops of coconut yogurt.
Add the next layer of cake and repeat.
Top the cake with another layer of coconut yogurt and a few dollops of the jam.
Swirl the coconut and jam together and then top with fresh raspberries and strawberries.
•
Enjoy and please let me know if you have any questions. Ash✌🏻x #gatherandfeast

our breakfast this morning - Spiced Berry & Orange Breakfast Crumble 🍓🍊🤗 RECIPE below👇🏻
•
this crumble is perfect served warm from the oven, but also stores well in the fridge (after it’s baked) for quick on-the-go breakfasts. it could also be served as a great healthy dessert - so many options!!👌🏻 this crumble topping might also just be my new favourite - it’s so chewy & crunchy, YUM! here's the new recipe... enjoy! x
•
INGREDIENTS
•
5 cups of frozen mixed berries (or fresh)
Zest & juice of 1 large orange
1 tbs vanilla extract or paste
•
FOR THE CRUMBLE
•
1 1/2 cup oats
1 1/2 cup coconut (i’ve used a mix of shredded & flaked)
1 cup almond meal
2 tbs chia seeds
1 tbs vanilla extract
1 tbs cinnamon
1 tsp allspice
Pinch sea salt
1/2 cup coconut oil or butter
1/3 cup pure maple or 1/4 cup honey (this recipe isn’t super sweet, so if you prefer it sweeter test the crumble before baking & add extra sweetener as needed)
•
METHOD
•
Combine the berries, orange zest, orange juice and vanilla in a medium sized baking dish.
In a medium sized mixing bowl add the oats, coconut, almond meal, chia seeds, vanilla, cinnamon, all spice, & sea salt - then stir to combine.
Add the coconut oil or butter, using your hands, rub and mix it into the dry mixture until completely incorporated.
Add the maple & stir to combine.
Using your hands, add the crumble mixture to the baking dish over the berries, creating ‘clumps’ of the crumble mixture as you add it. This will create nice crunchy, chewy bits of the crumble on top.
Bake at 180C / 350F for 30 minutes.
Remove from the oven and serve with your favourite yoghurt or coconut yoghurt.
Enjoy! 🙌🏻 Ash x  #gatherandfeast

YUM!! 😍🥑🥙✨ NEW RECIPE👇🏻 Green Pea & Herby Falafels - with Beet Hummus, Grilled Halloumi, Sliced Avo, Fresh Herbs & Quick Pickled Red Onions 🤗 A few of my fav's! Here's the recipe for the falafel and wrap/salad... enjoy! x
•
Green Pea & Herby Falafel
•
INGREDIENTS
•
1 ½ cups dried chickpeas - soaked in filtered water overnight, then drained
½ red onion
1 cup fresh coriander
1 ½ cups fresh parsley
2 tbs extra virgin olive oil
2 tbs apple cider vinegar or lemon juice
1 cup frozen peas
2 ½ tsp ground cumin
2 tsp whole coriander seeds
1 tsp baking powder
1 tsp smokey paprika
4 cloves garlic, peeled
1 tsp flaked sea salt
•
METHOD
•
Pulse together the falafel ingredients in a food processor until the mixture is combined and mixed together, but still has texture. You want the mixture to be a little chunky but not a smooth paste.
Roll the mixture into balls about 1 ½ tbs in size and place onto two paper-lined baking trays.
Drizzle the falafel balls with olive oil and bake at 250C / 480F for 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and allow to cool slightly.
•
I’ve served my falafels in flatbreads with beetroot hummus, sliced avocado, rainbow beets, fresh mint and coriander leaves, grilled halloumi, and quick pickled red onion (I soak red onion slices in apple cider vinegar for 30 minutes).
•
These ingredients are also delicious served in a salad instead of a flatbread...
Place some shredded lettuce and kale in a serving bowl, top with dollops of hummus, sliced avocado, fresh mint leaves, fresh coriander leaves, grilled halloumi, falafel, and quick pickled onion.
Drizzle with olive oil and a squeeze of lemon juice and serve. 👌🏻☺️
•
Enjoy the recipe and feel free to ask any questions! Ash✌🏻❤️ #gatherandfeast

Coconut, Raspberry & Strawberry Layer Cake 🍓🥥😍 If you missed it, I just posted this NEW cake RECIPE - copied in below👇🏻 ALSO, a Happy Thanksgiving to all my northern hemisphere friends!! Hope you’re enjoying time with loved ones and eating lots of delicious food!✌🏻
•
INGREDIENTS
•
Coconut Sponge Cake
•
6 large eggs, separated
1 ¼ cup pure maple syrup
1 tsp vanilla (extract, powder or paste)
150g solid coconut oil, melted and set aside to cool slightly
1 ½ cups blanched almond meal
1 ½ cups dessicated coconut
¾ cup buckwheat flour
1 tsp bicarb soda
2 tsp baking powder
2 tsp apple cider vinegar
1 ½ cups coconut milk
½ tsp flaked sea salt
•
Filling
•
500g thick coconut yoghurt (I like to use @coyo_organic)
1 cup good quality raspberry jam
Fresh strawberries & raspberries for topping
•
METHOD
•
Coconut Sponge Cake
•
Pre-heat your oven to 180C / 350F.
Grease and line 3 x 20cm round cake tins.
Whisk together the egg yolks and maple until light and fluffy.
Add the vanilla and melted coconut oil, whisk to combine.
Fold in the almond meal, coconut, buckwheat flour, bicarb, baking soda and apple cider vinegar, until just combined.
Add the coconut milk and sea salt and fold together to combine.
Whisk egg whites until stiff and fold through the mixture.
Pour the mixture evenly into the three pre-prepared tins.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and set aside to cool completely.
Remove the cakes from the tins and set aside to cool.
•
To Assemble
•
Spread the first cake layer with raspberry jam and a few dollops of coconut yogurt.
Add the next layer of cake and repeat.
Top the cake with another layer of coconut yogurt and a few dollops of the jam.
Swirl the coconut and jam together and then top with fresh raspberries and strawberries.
•
Enjoy the recipe and please let me know if you have any questions. Ash✌🏻 x  #gatherandfeast

chocolate & beetroot layer cake 🍫✨🥑 with avocado cacao fudge frosting, sprinkled with cacao nibs, freeze-dried beetroot, rose petals + fleur de sel - by far my most popular cake recipe + it's also grain-free, refined sugar-free & dairy free (with vegan options) 🙌🏻 RECIPE link in my BIO!✌🏻 x  #gatherandfeast
✨🥑 sliced avo on sourdough toast - with rainbow beets, fresh basil, black pepper, sea salt + olive oil 🤗 always a winner!!👌🏻 x #gatherandfeast

peanut butter & spiced berry jam pancake stack!! 🍇🥜🥞 this mornings breakfast for two! 🤗 to make these fluffy buckwheat pancakes you’ll need...
★
4 eggs, separated
¾ cup almond milk
1 cup buckwheat flour
1½ tsp baking powder
1 tbs coconut sugar or sugar of choice
¼ tsp sea salt
★
in a large bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, almond milk, buckwheat flour, baking powder, sugar and sea salt until smooth.
★
in a separate medium-sized bowl, whisk the egg whites until very stiff and then fold through the hotcake batter.
★
cook the hot cakes in a hot pan with a little butter or coconut oil (about 30-60 seconds each side) until golden. (i also have a video on my IGTV that shows you how to make these)
★
for the berries, add 3 cups frozen berries to a pan with a tbs of pure maple or honey, a little vanilla extract, cinnamon powder and allspice. simmer for 5-10 minutes.
★
stack the pancakes, top with coconut yoghurt, the warm spiced berry jam, a generous spoonful of smooth peanut butter and fresh mint or lemon balm leaves.
★
enjoy! Ash✌🏻✨ #gatherandfeast

✨🍳 testing new TACO recipes -- fried egg & kimchi with slices of avocado, fresh coriander leaves, a spread of mayo, a sprinkling of sea salt, chili, and a drizzle of olive oil... simple & delicious!! 🤗 Ash x  #gatherandfeast

Fresh tomato & buffalo mozzarella toasted sandwiches with @barillaaus delicious basil pesto 🍃🍅🍞 RECIPE below👇🏻 Last month I was lucky enough to visit the Barilla factory in Parma, Italy where I learnt how they grow and harvest basil once a year to make the freshest pesto👌🏻🍃 I usually like to make my own, but this pesto is my NEW fav - especially when I'm short on time! It's delicious in pasta and also these ridiculously good toasted sandwiches! 🙌🏻✨ This recipe is one of Mike's favourites and it disappeared as soon as we finished shooting!😂 Enjoy! x
•
INGREDIENTS
•
Fresh crusty bread (I like to use a crusty sourdough)
@barillaaus Basil Pesto Genovese
Fresh tomatoes, sliced
Fresh buffalo mozzarella or bocconcini (or your favourite cheese), torn or sliced
Fresh basil leaves
Olive oil or butter
Black pepper
Sea salt
•
METHOD
•
Butter or drizzle a little olive oil on the bread slices and then turn them over.
Spread each slice with a generous amount of Barilla Basil Pesto.
Top one side of the bread with tomato slices, fresh buffalo mozzarella (or your favourite cheese), fresh basil leaves, and a little salt & pepper.
Place the other slice of bread on top and gently press down.
Heat a frying pan over medium heat. Once the pan is hot add the sandwich and cook until one side is golden brown.
Gently flip the sandwich over with a spatula and cook the other side until the cheese is melty and the bread is golden.
Remove from the pan, slice in half and enjoy!! 🤗✨🍃 Ash x  #gatherandfeast #barillaaus #ba_sponsor #mastersofpasta

🍓 keeping with yesterday’s toast theme... thyme, vanilla & maple roasted strawberries on fresh ricotta - so YUM!👌🏻 the roasted strawberry recipe is from the other day - I’ve copied it below 🤗
•
Roasted Strawberries 🍓
Simply slice a heap of strawberries (I’ve used about 4 x 250g punnets), a tablespoon or two of pure maple (or sweetener of choice), 1 vanilla bean or 1 tbs vanilla paste, and a few fresh thyme sprigs 👌🏻 bake at 180C / 350F for 15-20 minutes. Enjoy! #gatherandfeast

a little lunch spread ✨🥑🥕🍃🍞 some of our favourite toppings on crusty sourdough toast --- avocado with watermelon radish, olive oil & basil --- hummus with roasted carrots, chili & fresh parsley --- avocado & fried eggs with parsley & olive oil --- avocado & haloumi with olive oil & chili 🤗🙌🏻 which would you choose?! 🍳🥑🍃 ash✌🏻 x  #gatherandfeast

Coconut, Oat & Raspberry Chocolate ‘Lamington’ Slice 😍👌🏻🍫🥥✨ Guys, this slice is soooo good! My family are obsessed with it (after receiving all my test versions) I hope you will love it too! I just finished making this new batch over the weekend 🤗 Here's the final recipe... x
•
INGREDIENTS
•
2 cups roasted almonds
2 cups coconut, shredded, flaked or desiccated
2 cups rolled oats
120g dates - roughly 6-7 fresh Medjool dates, pitted - OR - packet pitted dates, soaked in boiling water for 10 minutes then drained
⅓ cup coconut oil, solid
¼ cup pure maple syrup
1 tbs vanilla extract, paste or powder
A pinch of sea salt
•
⅓ cup raspberry jam - I like to use the brand ‘St. Dalfour’ as it has no added sugar, but any raspberry jam will work just fine
•
¾ cup cacao powder
¾ cup coconut oil
¼ cup pure maple syrup
Tiny pinch sea salt
•
1 cup coconut flakes (for sprinkling)
•
METHOD
•
Add the almonds, coconut, oats, dates, coconut oil, maple, vanilla and sea salt to a food processor.
Blend until combined and the mixture begins to stick together.
Line a 26x13cm brownie pan with non-stick paper.
Add ⅔ of the oat mixture to the prepared tin, pressing down firmly with your hands.
Spread over the raspberry jam.
Sprinkle the remaining oat mixture over the jam layer so it is completely covered.
Gently press it down firmly.
Add the cacao powder, coconut oil, maple and sea salt to a small saucepan.
Melt over low to medium heat, continually stirring as it melts.
Once smooth remove from the heat. Try not to overheat the mixture - it will be quite thick so stirring continuously is a must. It should only take about a minute or two to come together.
Pour the chocolate mixture over the oat and jam layers, sprinkle with the coconut and place in the freezer to set for a few hours.
Remove from the freezer, cut into bite size pieces and enjoy!
Store the slice in an airtight container in the fridge. It will keep for 1-2 weeks. It also keeps well in the freezer for 4-6 weeks.
•
Enjoy! Ash✌🏻 x  #gatherandfeast

PAV LOVE!! 😍✨🍓 Complete with vanilla custard cream, passionfruit curd, strawberries, blackberries, raspberries, blueberries & fresh mint! Yum!!👌🏻 This was our Christmas pavlova from last year - I was thinking of filming a step-by-step recipe VIDEO for it 🎥 now that Christmas is just over 2 months away! 😱🎄 Would you guys be interested in this family size pavlova recipe?? Ash x  #gatherandfeast

🍓😍 vanilla + thyme maple roasted STRAWBERRIES✨ does anyone else LOVE roasted fruit!?
•
to make these simply slice a heap of strawberries (I’ve used about 4 x 250g punnets), a tablespoon or two of pure maple (or sweetener of choice), 1 vanilla bean or 1 tbs vanilla paste, and a few fresh thyme sprigs 👌🏻 bake at 180C / 350F for 15-20 minutes. this would also be delicious using stone fruit instead of strawberries 🍑🍐
•
this roasted fruit is delicious with thick yoghurt, on porridge, on sourdough toast, with fresh ricotta or nut butter, or on ice cream - YUM! 🙌🏻 ash x #gatherandfeast

salad love 😍🌱🥥🥒 a mix of cucumber, green beans, snow pea shoots, sliced radishes, red onion, toasted coconut flakes & black sesame seeds -- tossed in a little olive oil, apple cider vinegar & sea salt -- then plated with whole smoked salmon pieces, soba noodles marinated in sesame oil + ponzu (japanese vinegar sauce), & served with wasabi mayo 👌🏻❤️ x #gatherandfeast

Homemade Almond Butter -- ‘how-to’ VIDEO 🎥✨ many of you have been asking me how I make my almond butter, so here’s a quick & easy step by step... is anyone else an almond butter lover?! 😍✨
•
INGREDIENTS
•
Dry roasted almonds (any amount you like) I usually make 750g or 1kg at a time - we love almond butter in our house! 😬
A big pinch of sea salt
•
METHOD
•
Add the almonds and sea salt to a food processor and blend.
Keep blending - it will begin to look like almond meal.
Continue blending - it will begin to look smooth but still very very thick.
You guessed it, keep blending! You want to blend until it’s super smooth, shiny and quite runny. This takes 5-10 minutes depending on your food processor.
Pour the almond butter into a clean and dry jar and store in the fridge.
•
We love adding almond butter to our smoothies, on porridge, with yoghurt & fruit, and inside frozen medjool dates for a delicious snack👌🏻
•
Enjoy guys!✌🏻 Ash x #gatherandfeast
